reviewText: Ken Olin, Mr. Nice Guy in "Thirty Something," plays a very believable sociopath named Brad Cunningham in "Dead by Sunset," which is based on Ann Rule's book.  Annette O'Toole, as his 4th wife, is a successful lawyer, completely at a loss when trying to deal with her husband who viciously manipulates and humiliates her, then surprises her by doing something loving.But Brad is through with the marriage when he meets a well-to-do if naive doctor played by Lindsay Frost, who believes in Brad completely.Olin does a superb job as the bad guy, as does O'Toole as his wife.  The other actors don't match their intensity---the movie belongs to Olin and O'Toole.The support system that Cunningham's fourth, very liberated wife had was amazing, but it didn't save her from being killed.  At least that support system eventually helps her family to get justice.

reviewText: This movie is excellent as far as Lifetime Movies go.  It is one of their multi-hour flicks, and when it's completed it feels like only an hour went by, not 4.  I've read the book by Ann Rule, and this story is just heartbreaking and suspenseful.  This is definitely one Lifetime movie that should be released on DVD and added to their True Stories Collection!!

reviewText: I read the book first, then when this movie was filmed I was overjoyed that the plot was exactly the way that Ann Rule wrote it.So many times an excellent book is ruined by the film industry---not this one.If you have never read her True Crime books you should try them, they are spellbinding and she is a prolific writer.I have been a fan of hers for 20 years and have never been disappointed.

reviewText: I had seen this movie on True Stories Channel in 2001 or 2002 uncut.  Never seen it on Lifetime or LMN.  This is an excellent movie. Full of suspense and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  One you don't want to miss a second of.  Annette O'Toole played an excellent part of being the 3rd wife.  Ken Olin was truly off in the head.  Got his wives before he married them to believe his every word and once married did the same, than he started to get mean.  For this to have really happened in life and they made a movie out of it, is shocking and hard to believe that these women went through pure heck with this man.  This is a must see. Once you watch it, you will want to watch it over and over again. I haven't purchased the DVD yet but will.  So not sure if any of it is cut from the original movie that was on True Stories Channel (which it's not called True movies anymore not sure what that channel is called now as I don't have movie channels.) I'd say it would be one to get because no matter the movie will keep you on the edge of your seat. This truly a domestic violence and beyond movie.  Hard to believe a man could do any of these deep mind games with the women he married and put them pure heck. The man was truly insane and that's putting it mildly.The forth wife ended up finding justice for the third wife that was murdered and did a very good job of how she done that.  I'm was so glad that justice prevailed on something that happened in life.The DVD needed to be out long before this. I'd like to find out if this movie came out on DVD from the True Movie channel, because that would be uncut.  I will be getting the LMN version to see the difference between these movies.
Title: N/A
